tweets.author: malthe
tweets.text: @francismori7 No, just Eero to AT&T Fiber. Just set DNS to 8.8.8.8 and I don't *think* have Eero configured to do anything "smart". But ping indeed says `cannot resolve https://t.co/KstWWy4fg5: Unknown host`. 🤔

tweets.author: elrebelde4
tweets.text: @tazmom @AskFrontier In my case it appears to be only the DNS server. If I'm connected, the connection is not lost. Try to change your dns server to a free one like google (8.8.8.8,8.8.4.4), opendns, cloudflare, etc

tweets.author: PakKrish
tweets.text: @rixzkyfn update ethernet drivers, optimize them, use 8.8.8.8 8.8.4.4 or 1.1.1.1 1.0.0.1

tweets.author: GameClou
tweets.text: @deviousix @FJT2511 @Respawn @PlayApex I've got all of that wired dns 1.1.1.1 or the Google 8.8.8.8 also the 1st one ever 208.67.222.222 208.67.220.220 the 20hz servers are just trash

tweets.author: MylesBorins
tweets.text: @davidlymanning I'm still wrapping my head around how the 127.0.0.1 dnsmasq stuff works and why that is the deafult provisioned directly into the secure gateway... and want to confirm that I'm using my configured 1.1.1.1 primary and 8.8.8.8 secondary.... then I want to get dig to work

tweets.author: davidlymanning
tweets.text:
@MylesBorins I changed a domain alias in a way that _should_ have been totally fine. EdgeRouter decided that it didn't know about the upstream DNS server anymore and couldn't possibly be expected to acquire it.

TL;DR I'm running on 8.8.8.8 till I feel like dealing with it again.

tweets.author: deviousix
tweets.text:
@FJT2511 @Respawn @PlayApex I play daily 4 hrs sessions 
My internet is 300mb Download 15mb upload wired to ps4 not wi fi
My DNS is custom google primary
 8.8.8.8 secondary 8.8.4.4
Also my ps4 is always up to date and I rebuild my data base at least once a month.

tweets.author: mpk
tweets.text: One Google product I can still encourage people to use, everywhere, without hesitation is HonestDNS (8.8.8.8, 8.8.4.4). It just works, it doesn’t store any of your personal data, and it’s really fast. Also the people who implemented it are really nice.

tweets.author: xbox_chief
tweets.text: @CURT_BLOOM @XboxSupport You can try to setup a different DNS server, this might help. You could use googles which is 8.8.8.8 or cloudflares which is the fastest 1.1.1.1. keep in mind that those company's "know" what you are doing if you use their dns server.
